parameters.name: InstanceIds
parameters.description:
The database instance IDs.

>  Set this parameter to a JSON array that consists of multiple instance IDs. Separate instance IDs with commas (,). Example: `['Instance ID1', 'Instance ID2']`.

parameters.name: ResultId
parameters.description:
The ID of the asynchronous request.

>  Asynchronous calls do not immediately return the complete results. To obtain the complete results, you must use the value of **ResultId** returned in the response to re-initiate the call until the value of **isFinish** is **true**.**** In this case, you must call this operation at least twice.

parameters.name: TableFragmentationRatio
parameters.description: The fragmentation rate that triggers automatic fragment recycling of a single physical table. Valid values: **0.10** to **0.99**.

parameters.name: TableSpaceSize
parameters.description: The minimum storage usage that triggers automatic fragment recycling of a single physical table. Valid values: **5** to **100**. Unit: GB.
